terms.definition: Invalid Ownership means a claim to own property or assets that is not legally recognized, enforceable, or legitimate.
A Lawful Owner is the individual or entity who legally possesses the rights to a property or asset and can exercise control over it.
Unauthorized Possession refers to holding or occupying property or assets without the legal right or permission of the true owner.
Invalid claims of ownership are assertions of legal right to property or assets that are not supported by law or legitimate documentation.
A registered conveyance is the official, legally recorded transfer of property ownership from one party to another, documented with the appropriate government agency.
A sale deed is a legal document that formally transfers the ownership of a property from the seller to the buyer upon completion of a sale.
A valid transfer is a legal process where ownership of property or assets is legitimately moved from one party to another, adhering to all applicable laws and regulations.
